intro: Kibara mollis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and thrives in well-draining soil. Kibara mollis is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, making it a favorite among gardeners.
